summary: An email from attorney Jeffrey S. Pop to an unidentified recipient, apologizing for mistakenly addressing a prior email to a woman as 'MI' and attaching that prior email. The email discusses uncertainty about proper contacts and seeks guidance on how to proceed, and includes a confidentiality notice.

persons.name: Jeffrey S. Pop
persons.context: Author of the email, apologizing for mistakenly addressing a prior email to a woman as 'MI' and seeking guidance on how to proceed.

events.title: Introductory Email Sent
events.description: Jeffrey Pop sent an introductory email that he mistakenly addressed to a woman, referring to her as 'MI'.

events.title: Apology and Follow-up Email
events.description: Jeffrey Pop sends this email apologizing for the mistake in the prior email and seeking guidance on how to proceed.

keyFacts: Attorney Jeffrey S. Pop mistakenly addressed a prior email to a woman, referring to her as 'MI'.
Pop expresses uncertainty about whether he should have contacted the recipient or another party.
The email includes a strong confidentiality notice asserting attorney-client privilege or work-product doctrine.
